note.p: Career: Accompanied Edward Montagu, 1st Earl of Sandwich (FRS 1663) on an embassy to Spain (1666); Military Engineer at Tangier (1669-1683); Officer in the Artillery at the Battle of Sedgemoor (1685); Surveyor of the Ordnance (1685); twice arrested for conspiring on behalf of James II (1690, 1696); one of the trustees to regulate William III's Irish grants (1700)
References: Edward H Cohen and John S Ross, 'The Commonplace Book of Edmond Halley' in NR 1985-86 vol 40 pp 1-40
Notes: Proposed by Sir Joseph Williamson
